ssGUI
namespace
ssGUI
ssGUI::​Enums
namespace
ssGUI::​Enums
Types
MenuSpawnDirection
ssGUI::​Menu
public
ssGUI::​Widget
ssGUI::​Menu

This class manages ssGUI::MenuItem to show menus such as right click menu or menu bar menu

Variables & Constructor
protected:
    glm::vec2 SpawnGlobalPosition;                                  //See <SpawnMenu>
    ssGUI::Enums::MenuSpawnDirection CurrentMenuSpawnDirection;     //See <GetMenuSpawnDirection>
    ssGUI::GUIObject* MenuTarget;                                   //See <GetMenuTarget>
Menu::Menu() :  SpawnGlobalPosition(),
                CurrentMenuSpawnDirection(ssGUI::Enums::MenuSpawnDirection::BOTTOM_RIGHT),
                MenuTarget(nullptr)
{
    SetSize(glm::vec2(200, GetSize().y));
    AddExtension(ssGUI::Factory::Create<ssGUI::Extensions::Layout>());
    AddExtension(ssGUI::Factory::Create<ssGUI::Extensions::Border>());
    GetAnyExtension<ssGUI::Extensions::Layout>()->SetPadding(2);
    GetAnyExtension<ssGUI::Extensions::Layout>()->SetSpacing(0);
    SetBackgroundColor(glm::u8vec4(150, 150, 150, 255));
    AddTag(ssGUI::Tags::FLOATING);
}
Variables
ListenerKey
static const std::string ListenerKey
Functions
GetMenuSpawnDirection
ssGUI::Enums::MenuSpawnDirection GetMenuSpawnDirection(
glm::vec2 globalSpawnPosition
)

When spawning the menu, it can be positioned differently depending on the spawn position.  This returns the spawn direction against the globalSpawnPosition

SpawnMenu
void SpawnMenu(
glm::vec2 globalPosition
)

Spawns the menu at globalPosition

CanForceSpawnMenu
bool CanForceSpawnMenu(
glm::vec2 globalSpawnPosition,
ssGUI::Enums::MenuSpawnDirection direction
)

You can spawn the menu with a specified spawn direction, this function returns if such operation is possible.

ForceSpawnMenu
void ForceSpawnMenu(
glm::vec2 globalPosition,
ssGUI::Enums::MenuSpawnDirection direction
)

Spawn the menu with a spawn direction specified.

RegisterMenuItem
void RegisterMenuItem(
ssGUI::MenuItem* menuItem
)

Sets the menu item's parent to the menu and register different callbacks internally

RemoveMenuItem
void RemoveMenuItem(
ssGUI::MenuItem* menuItem
)

Deletes the menu item

LinkMenuItemToSubMenu
void LinkMenuItemToSubMenu(
ssGUI::MenuItem* menuItem,
ssGUI::Menu* subMenu
)

Links a sub menu against a menu item, the sub menu must be parented to the menu in order for it to work properly.

SetMenuTarget
void SetMenuTarget(
ssGUI::GUIObject* target
)

Sets the target of the menu that is spawned on, meaning the GUI Object that "spawns" the menu.  Please note that this should be called together with SpawnMenu or ForceSpawnMenu To unset the target, set it to nullptr.

GetMenuTarget
ssGUI::GUIObject* GetMenuTarget() const

Gets the target of the menu that is spawned on, meaning the GUI Object that "spawns" the menu.  This can return nullptr if not a specific GUI Object spawned it.
